title: How should I learn AP Style? - Quora

response.answer_text: Pick up the latest AP Style Guidebook and never go anywhere without it. A bit of an exaggeration, but still has some truth to it. In my final year of school it was used in all my classes. Every report, every presentation, everything I did. I took it with me and kept it with me. I would review it at work, at home, and everywhere else.

There is no particular trick to it. Grab a copy of the AP Stylebook and use it.Amazon.co.uk: Associated Press: Books First time around, it might be best to just write your article, then apply the editing guidelines. As you do this more often, you will become familiar with the style and start to write in a manner which is more fitting to that end. In essence, though, it is no different from applying any editorial style guide, save that it is one of the most comprehensive. Thanks for the A2A. HTH. K
